p: Recent phylogenetic analysis has revealed that the new virus which commenced its spreading from China is a version of SARS-CoV[ 37, 38]. There are two significant similarities between SARS-CoV-2 (nCoV-2019) and SARS-CoV: they share nearly 80% of their genetic codes, and both were originated in bats [ 39, 40]. The first study to analyze the viral genome analysis was conducted by the Wuhan Institute of Virology (TableÂ 2). Samples from seven patients initially complaining of severe pneumonia were used in the report. It was found that the genetic of SARS-CoV-2 was 79.5%, similar to SARS-CoV [ 41].
